intro: Pedicularis artselaeri, commonly known as the Alpine beardlip orchid, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the high-altitude regions of Europe. It belongs to the genus Pedicularis, which is part of the family Orobanchaceae, commonly known as the broomrape family. This plant is characterized by its striking, spurred flowers that range in color from yellow to orange, often resembling a beard. It typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Due to its specialized habitat, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many parts of its range.
